title: When women get constant and endless validation from men, we all lose.
caption: false

channel_info.title: Robbie Kramer
channel_info.description:
I'm Robbie Kramer 🎙Host of The Inner Confidence Podcast & Founder of Inner Confidence, Inc.

I lived an exhilarating single life filled with adventures and lessons, and ultimately achieved what I had always aspired to – finding an amazing, feminine, and loving wife. 

I believe my experiences provide a rare balance of wild freedom and committed love, equipping me with the insights to help you navigate the complexities of dating and relationships in today's world. Let me guide you to embrace your desires, improve your social prowess, and ultimately attract the partner who aligns with your highest aspirations.

You won’t find any fluffy, new-age, or cringy stuff here, just tested, proven and actionable advice that yields results.

Apply to join our exclusive Inner Confidence Community of ambitious men who are actively working together to achieve their goals faster   ► https://innerconfidence.com/community

You can email me at robbie@innerconfidence.com with any questions or comments.

transcription: {"text": "When a girl gets hit on a million times a day, she starts letting it go, and then she sees, oh, like, I'm still getting hit on same amount of times, so I'm going to let that thing go, and then not get makeup, and then not do my hair, and then I still get the same amount of guys. Why should I bother? Why should I go to the gym? Why should I get dressed? Why should I get this and that? That's the reality. In Israel, it's also the same like that, because there's more guys than girls, and so they get the attention anyways, whether they try or not. The theory is as the ratio gets more and more skewed towards men, women stop caring and taking care of themselves because the attention and validation comes easy, right? Exactly, exactly. Supplying the men, the basic supply and demand, man. If you have more women, they compete for less guys, so they try, they go to the gym, they get their makeup done, they get their hair done, and if they see, oh, I didn't do my hair done today, and I still get picked up everywhere, like, stuff like that. It's pick-up evolution, I guess. Pimponomics. Evolutionary psychology.
